item.title: Report E-2023100181
item.description:
Report E-2023100181

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: CARNESVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 03, 2023, at 1049 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Carnesville, Georgia regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of ZAC (Corrosive liquid, n.o.s UN 1760, 8, III) from (1) 55-gallon DF. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by a loose bung cap and contained to the trailer floor and a small area of asphalt below the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release and all waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

Report X-2023090852

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE DURING SHIPPING AND HANDLING. BOTTLES LEAKED OUT AS A RESULT. PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION. DescribePack: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION FOR POCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023100211
item.description:
Report E-2023100211

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the hose and the tank adaptor became compromised. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of gasoline to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
